histogram.name: Apps.AppInfoDialog.CreateExtensionShortcutSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the result of creating shortcuts for an Extension, specifically from the user clicking on "Create Shortcut" on the chrome://apps page, in the right click menu of the respective Extension icon.

histogram.name: Apps.AppInfoDialog.CreateWebAppShortcutSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the result of creating shortcuts for a WebApp, specifically from the user clicking on "Create Shortcut" on the chrome://apps page, in the right click menu of the respective WebApp icon.

histogram.name: Apps.AppInfoDialog.Launches
histogram.summary: The number of times the app info dialog is launched. This is gathered each time the app info dialog is opened, from each of the places the dialog can be opened from.

histogram.name: Apps.AppInfoDialog.OpenedForLocation
histogram.summary: The location of the app that the dialog was opened for. This is gathered each time the app info dialog is opened.

histogram.name: Apps.AppInfoDialog.OpenedForType
histogram.summary: The type of the app that the dialog was opened for. This is gathered each time the app info dialog is opened.

histogram.name: Apps.AppLaunch
histogram.summary: The number of times v2 packaged apps are launched grouped by extension_misc::AppLaunchBuckets. See also Extensions.AppLaunch.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.AggregatedMlAppRankFail
histogram.summary: The number of apps the were not able to be ranked by the Aggregated ML app ranker (Top Cat).

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.AggregatedMlAppRankSuccess
histogram.summary: The number of apps successfully ranked by the Aggregated ML app ranker (Top Cat).

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.AggregatedSearchRankerError
histogram.summary: The type of errors that occur during the inference of Search Ranking aggregated model.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.AnswerCardSearchProvider.SearchAnswerLoadingTime
histogram.summary: The time between sending an answer card request and receiving the notification that answer card has finished loading.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.AnswerCardSearchProvider.SearchAnswerNavigationTime
histogram.summary: The time between sending an answer card request and receiving the notification navigation has been finished with a valid answer card.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.AppSearchProvider.QueryTime
histogram.summary: The time between sending a non-empty query to AppSearchProvider and receiving results back.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.AppSearchProvider.ZeroStateLatency
histogram.summary: The time between sending an empty query to AppSearchProvider and receiving Zero State recommendation results back.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.AppsGridAddPage
histogram.summary: The different ways to add page in app list's apps grid. Logged when the page is created.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.CardifiedStateAnimation.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of entering or exiting the cardified state in the apps grid. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded one time per apps grid page each time we enter or exit cardified state in the apps grid.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveQuickAccessProvider.ApiResults
histogram.summary: The number of results returned from a call to the Drive QuickAccess API. Only reported if the API call did not error.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveQuickAccessProvider.CacheEmpty
histogram.summary: Whether or not the results cache is empty. An empty cache means either poor network conditions, the user opening zero-state very quickly, or an API error.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveQuickAccessProvider.CacheWarmed
histogram.summary: Whether or not the cache of Drive file results has already been warmed with a request to ItemSuggest. Emitted each time we decide whether to warm the cache, ie. each time Drive FS is mounted.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveQuickAccessProvider.DriveFSMounted
histogram.summary: Whether or not DriveFS is mounted on a call to DriveQuickAccessProvider::Start or ::GetQuickAccessItems.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveQuickAccessProvider.FileError
histogram.summary: The error code returned from a call to the Drive QuickAccess API.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveQuickAccessProvider.GetQuickAccessItemsLatency
histogram.summary: The time between when GetQuickAccessItems was last called, and receiving Drive QuickAccess results back. Only reported if the API call did not error.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveQuickAccessProvider.Latency
histogram.summary: The time between sending a zero state query and receiving file recommendations back from the DriveQuickAccessProvider.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveQuickAccessProvider.TimeFromFetchToZeroStateStart
histogram.summary: The time between when GetQuickAccessItems was last called, and the user entering zero state search.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveQuickAccessProvider.ValidResults
histogram.summary: Counts how many results from one call to the QuickAccess API exist in the DriveFS mount and are OK for display.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveSearchProvider.Latency
histogram.summary: Latency in milliseconds from the beginning of a launcher search query to Drive file results being returned. Logged once per Drive search query.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveSearchProvider.Relevance
histogram.summary: Relevance score for a Drive file result that was returned in response to a search query. Logged once for each file per search query.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveSearchProvider.Status
histogram.summary: The outcome of a query for Drive file results. Logged once per Drive search query.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveZeroStateProvider.Latency
histogram.summary: The time between sending a zero state query and receiving file recommendations back from DriveZeroStateProvider.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.DriveZeroStateProvider.Status
histogram.summary: The outcome of a query for search results from DriverZeroStateProvider. Recorded once per zero-state query.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.FileResult.DefaultRelevanceUsed
histogram.summary: Whether or not the default relevance was used when calculating the relevance score between a filename and the search query. The default relevance is used as a fallback whenever the relevance calculation fails. Logged once per relevance calculation.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.FileSearchProvider.Latency
histogram.summary: Latency in milliseconds from the beginning of a launcher search query to local file results being returned. Logged once per file search query.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.FileSearchProvider.Relevance
histogram.summary: Relevance score for a local file result that was returned in response to a search query. Logged once for each file per search query.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.FileSearchProvider.TimedOut
histogram.summary: Whether or not local file search was exited early due to a time out. Logged once per file search query.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ItemSuggestCache.ResponseSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of a response from the ItemSuggest API. Reported once per successful response. Will not be reported if the response exceeds the maximum size, instead check Apps.AppList.ItemSuggestCache.Status.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ItemSuggestCache.Status
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to ItemSuggest. Reported once per call.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.LauncherSearchProvider.QueryTime
histogram.summary: The time between sending a non-empty query and receiving results back from the extension which performs the file search.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.OmniboxProvider.QueryTime
histogram.summary: The time between sending an non-empty query and receiving search results back from OmniboxProvider which queries chrome AutocompelteController's search providers to get the results.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.OmniboxProvider.ZeroStateLatency
histogram.summary: The time between sending an empty query and receiving zero state recommendations back from OmniboxProvider which queries chrome ZeroStateProvider and gets recent queries back from Google Autocomplete server.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.OsSettingsProvider.Error
histogram.summary: Various error states of the provider for OS settings in the cros launcher. Emitted only in the case of an unexpected error, the bucket proportion is not meaningful.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.OsSettingsProvider.QueryTime
histogram.summary: The latency of a search in the OsSettingsProvider. Recorded each time a search is completed, even if it returns no results. Not recorded if the query is too short to perform a search at all. Chrome OS only.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ScoreNormalizer.L2ErrorDecreased
histogram.summary: Whether or not splitting and merging bins is less than or equal to the old L2 error of bin counts. Logged after each search result is recorded.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ScoreNormalizer.ReadPrefsError
histogram.summary: Whether or not dividers and/or counts from read prefs is empty. A empty dividers or counts means one of the values in the vector was not saved properly as a double. Logged when the ScoreNormalizer is initialized, which is when ReadPrefs is called.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ScoreNormalizer.SearchResultsCount
histogram.summary: The number of search results which have been normalized. Logged when each vector of search results is normalized.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.SearchQueryLength.Apps
histogram.summary: The length of the query that resulted in an app launch from search box. This metric only records non-empty queries.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.SearchSuccess.Apps
histogram.summary: The number of app launches from the search box with non-empty queries.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.SuggestedContent.Enabled
histogram.summary: Whether or not the user has enabled Suggested Content in the launcher. This is logged once per UMA upload, and only for any user that has the Suggested Content toggle feature flag enabled.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.SuggestedFiles.ChipLaunched
histogram.summary: Emitted when a suggestion chip is launched. Currently only 'true' is used, but we may emit 'false' in future to track abandonment.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.SuggestedFiles.LaunchIndex
histogram.obsolete: Removed April 2021. Use the more general Apps.AppList.UserEvent.LaunchIndex instead.
histogram.summary: Emitted when a suggestion chip is launched, records the index (position in the bar) of that chip. The left-most chip is index 0 and the maximum index is 4.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.SuggestedFiles.LaunchType
histogram.summary: Emitted when a suggestion chip is launched, records the type of that chip.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.UserEvent.Error
histogram.summary: Records error when processing user events into Apps.AppList.UserEvent.* metrics. These are expected to be rare and bucket proportion is not meaningful.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.UserEvent.LaunchIndex
histogram.summary: Emitted on a usage of the launcher, and records overall impressions, launches, and abandons for a launcher UI view. The bucket proportion is not meaningful for this metric, because impressions are a superset of launches and abandons. Instead, the ratio between buckets can be used to calculate accurate overall CTR.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.UserEvent.Overall
histogram.summary: Emitted on a usage of the launcher, and records overall impressions, launches, and abandons for a launcher UI view. The bucket proportion is not meaningful for this metric, because impressions are a superset of launches and abandons. Instead, the ratio between buckets can be used to calculate accurate overall CTR.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.UserEvent.Query
histogram.summary: Emits true when the user enters a query into the Chrome OS launcher search box. Entering any number of characters is considered only one query, but deleting the contents of the search box and starting again is recorded as a new query.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.UserEvent.TypeAbandon
histogram.summary:
Emitted after an impression, if the user then closes the launcher or moves to a different view without launching any search result. This is emitted once per abandon, per displayed result. Records the displayed result's type. See Apps.AppList.UserEvent.TypeImpression for more details.
This metric is completed by a histogram suffix describing which UI surface the results are recorded from.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.UserEvent.TypeImpression
histogram.summary:
When a set of results is displayed for 2 seconds and the user has probably seen it, or the user interacted with the results and has definitely seen it, we consider it an impression.
Emitted once per impression for each displayed result. Records the type of the displayed result, eg. native app or omnibox bookmark.
The Apps.AppList.UserEvent.Type* metrics are directly comparable per-result-type. So, for example, (launches / impressions) for a result type gives an accurate CTR.
This metric is completed by a histogram suffix describing which UI surface the results are recorded from.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.UserEvent.TypeLaunch
histogram.summary:
Emitted after an impression, if the user launches a result. Records the type of the launched result. See Apps.AppList.UserEvent.TypeImpression for more details.
This metric is completed by a histogram suffix describing which UI surface the results are recorded from.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateFileProvider.Latency
histogram.summary: The time between sending a zero state query and receiving file recommendations back from the ZeroStateFileProvider.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateFileProvider.NotifierCreationSuccess
histogram.summary: Emitted when the ZeroStateFileProvider is created, records whether the FileTasksNotifier creation succeeded for the given profile.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResults.LaunchedItemType
histogram.summary: The type of item that was launched from a zero state launcher search result.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResults.ReceivedScore.DriveQuickAccess
histogram.summary: Logs the result score received from the Drive Quick Access provider. The original float score is scaled to range from 0 to 100 and its floor is recorded.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResults.ReceivedScore.OmniboxSearch
histogram.summary: Logs the result score received from the Omnibox search provider. The original float score is scaled to range from 0 to 100 and its floor is recorded.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResults.ReceivedScore.ZeroStateFile
histogram.summary: Logs the result score received from the zero state file provider. The original float score is scaled to range from 0 to 100 and its floor is recorded.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResultsList.Clicked
histogram.summary: Whether an item was clicked from zero state search results, or if results were displayed for some amount time but not clicked. These clicks and impressions are used for calculating CTR metrics.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResultsList.ContainsDriveFiles
histogram.summary: Whether a set of search result impressions contains any Drive QuickAccess file results.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResultsList.FileImpressions
histogram.summary: The number of zero state impressions that contained at least one result of the specified file type.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResultsList.LaunchedItemPositionV2
histogram.summary: The position index of an item launched from zero state search results.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResultsList.NumImpressionTypesV2
histogram.summary: The number of item types included in each zero state impression set.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateSearchResultRemovalDecision
histogram.summary: The decision of the user whether to remove a zero state search result. This is gathered per click of a remove or cancel button of a search result removal confirmation dialog.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateSearchResultUserActionType
histogram.summary: The type of the action user performed on zero state search result. This is gathered per click of a remove or append button of a search result.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateSuggestionOpenType
histogram.summary: The type of the app list suggestion that was opened by user in zero state.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListAppLaunchedV2
histogram.summary: The number of apps launched from the launcher and shelf for each launcher state. This is incremented each time an app is launched. Each bucket represents where in the launcher or shelf the app was launched from.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListAppMovingType
histogram.summary: The different ways to move an app in app list's apps grid. Logged when the app moving succeeds.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListAppTypeClicked
histogram.summary: The type of app clicked in the launcher on ChromeOS, recorded after the icon is clicked, before it is launched.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListBadgedAppsCount
histogram.summary: Number of apps (including ones in folders) with Chrome badge, across all Launcher pages. This is gathered per open-launcher event.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListCreationTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to build the app list UI. This is logged each time the app list is built from scratch.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListDefaultSearchResultOpenType
histogram.summary: The type of the default result opened by user by pressing ENTER key. Launcher UI shows suggested apps, recent queries, etc when user activates the search box, or shows matched apps (installed apps, play store app results, etc.) and other results (query suggestions, web site, bookmark, files, etc) when user types a query. It will set the focus on the first result as the default. User can open the default result by simply pressing ENTER key. This metrics logs the type of the default result (installed app, play store result, query suggestion, etc) opened by user pressing ENTER key.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListFolder.ShowHide.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of showing and hiding app list folder. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when the user starts the folder animation in the launcher.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListFolderNameLength
histogram.summary: The folder name length in characters when an app list folder gets renamed. Logged when the folder name is changed and the texfield is no longer in focus.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListFolderOpened
histogram.summary: The number of times folders are opened in the app list. This is logged when the folder is clicked.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListHide.InputLatency
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from the input event to hide the launcher UI. This is logged each time the launcher is dismissed by pressing search key, clicking shelf button, or focusing out side of the launcher.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListInternalApp.Activate
histogram.summary: The internal app in apps grid was opened by the user. This is gathered per click of an internal app.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListLauncherClickedSearchQueryLength
histogram.summary: Logs the length of user typed queries that result in launcher clicks. Emitted each time the user opens a launcher search result after typing a query.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListLauncherIssuedSearchQueryLength
histogram.summary: The UMA histogram that logs the length of user typed queries app list launcher issues to the search providers.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListPageOpened
histogram.summary: The page that the app list goes to. This is gathered every time the user initiates a transition to another page in the launcher.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListPageSwitcherSource
histogram.summary: The source used to switch pages in the app list's app grid. Logged when the page switch succeeds.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListPeekingToFullscreen
histogram.summary: Replaced with Apps.AppListPeekingToFullscreenSource on 9/2017.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListPeekingToFullscreenSource
histogram.summary: The source which transitions the app list from Peeking to Fullscreen. This is logged when the transition method is used.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListPlayStoreAppLaunchedIndex
histogram.summary: The index of the app within all play store apps displayed when it is launched.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListPlayStoreQueryState
histogram.summary: The state of a Play Store app search request.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListPlayStoreSearchAppsDisplayed
histogram.summary: The number of the play store apps displayed to user for a query.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListRecommendedImpResultCountAfterOpen
histogram.summary: When a user opens an app recommendation result, this is the number of times we showed the result before opening. Number of times shown is reset to 0 every 30 days, and is held on device.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListRecommendedResponse
histogram.summary: Response when parsing the recommended app list from Play Store for candidate app list, recorded every time a response from the play store is parsed in client.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListRecommendedResponse.Count
histogram.summary: Number of responses from server in Apps.AppListRecommendedResponse.count when fetching appListRecommendded GetAppReinstallCandidates.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListRecommendedResponse.Latency
histogram.summary: Milliseconds elapsed to fetch appListRecommended GetAppReinstallCandidates.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListResultLaunchIndexAndQueryLength
histogram.summary: The index of a clicked result in the search result box and the length of the search query. The index is relative to the SearchResultListView, not the overall position in the suggestion window.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListResultLaunchIsEmptyQuery
histogram.summary: This boolean records if the query that introduces a launch in the results list is empty or not. This will be recorded every time the user clicks an item in the launcher results list.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchAbandonQueryLength
histogram.summary: The length of the query when the user abandons results of a queried search or recommendations of zero state (zero length query) in launcher UI.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchBoxActivated
histogram.summary: The number of times the applist searchbox has been activated. This is split by keystroke, mouse press, and gesture tap activations. This is gathered each time the searchbox goes from inactive to active, not necessarily empty to non-empty.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchCommenced
histogram.summary: The number of searches that are started in the app list. This is gathered each time the app list search box transitions from empty to non-empty.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchOmniboxResultOpenType
histogram.summary: The type of app list search omnibox result that was opened by the user. This is gathered per OmniboxResult opened in the app list's launcher suggestion window.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchQueryLength
histogram.summary: The length of the app list search query when a result is opened. This is gathered per click of a search result.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchResultInternalApp.Open
histogram.summary: The app list search result of an internal app that was opened by the user. This is gathered per click of a search result.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchResultInternalApp.Show
histogram.summary: The app list search result of an internal app that was shown to the user. This is gathered per creation of a search result. Note: Typing a word with multiple letters could trigger multiple creations of the search result.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchResultOpenDisplayType
histogram.summary: The display type of the app list search result that was opened by the user. This is gathered per click of a search result.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchResultOpenedSource
histogram.summary: The state of the app list when a search result was opened.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchResultOpenTypeV2
histogram.summary: The type of app list search result that was opened by the user. This is gathered per SearchResult opened. Only recorded for search results shown in the search result page of the launcher (suggestion chips are not recorded).

histogram.name: Apps.AppListShow.InputLatency
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from the input event to show the launcher UI. This is logged each time the app list is shown by pressing search key, clicking shelf button, or swiping from shelf.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListShowSource
histogram.summary: The number of times the different sources for showing the app list are used. This is logged when the app list is shown. Does not count the app list shown when the last window is closed in tablet mode. This is not the total number of times the app list is shown to the user; for that consult the user action AppList_WindowFocused.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListStateTransitionSource
histogram.summary: The number of transitions from the different AppListStates. This is gathered each time the launcher transitions from various states in AppListView::SetState (Peeking, Half, Fullscreen All Apps, Fullscreen Search, and Closed). Not all state transitions are collected because they are not meaningful in measuring user activity.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSuggestedChipLaunched
histogram.summary: The number of times suggested chips are launched at each suggested-apps tile. An index i, ranged from 0 to kNumStartPageTiles - 1, is logged each time a suggested chip is launched from i-th tile.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSuggestedChipOpenType
histogram.summary: The type of app list suggestion chip that was opened by the user. This is gathered per SuggestionChip opened.

histogram.name: Apps.AppShimErrorVersion
histogram.summary: Counts which major milestone versions of app_mode_loader are sending --app-shim-error. --app-shim-error is sent as a command line argument to Chrome when app_mode_loader was unable to dyload the Chrome Framework and call ChromeAppModeMain. For example, when Chrome updates from 32-bit to 64-bit, an older shim will find the new framework version but fail to dyload it.

histogram.name: Apps.AppsInFolders
histogram.summary: The total number of apps in folders ignoring OEM folders. This is logged each time the app list is initialized. The "FullscreenAppListDisabled" suffix has been deprecated.

histogram.name: Apps.Bounced
histogram.summary: Records whether an application has bounced (been uninstalled in less than seven days). Recorded when an application is uninstalled.

histogram.name: Apps.ContextMenuExecuteCommand
histogram.summary: The number of times a certain command was executed by a context menu, split by whether the context menu came from an app, or another part of the system UI.

histogram.name: Apps.ContextMenuShowSource
histogram.summary: The show source (touch, mouse, keyboard, etc) for a context menu. Split by the component from which the context menu originated.

histogram.name: Apps.ContextMenuUserJourneyTime
histogram.summary: The user journey time for a ContextMenu, defined as the time between launching a context menu and the context menu's close callback being activated. Not recorded whenever the context menu is not for an app icon on the shelf.

histogram.name: Apps.CreateShortcutIcon.Linux.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of creating shortcut image for web app on Linux.

histogram.name: Apps.CreateShortcuts.Linux.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of creating shortcut for web app on Linux.

histogram.name: Apps.CreateShortcuts.Mac.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of creating shortcut for web app on MacOS.

histogram.name: Apps.DefaultAppLaunch
histogram.summary: Records when a user attempts to launch a particular Chrome OS app.

histogram.name: Apps.FileHandler.Registration.Linux.RecreateShortcut.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of re-creating shortcut during file handler registration process for PWA on Linux

histogram.name: Apps.FileHandler.Registration.Linux.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of file handler registration for PWA on Linux

histogram.name: Apps.FileHandler.Registration.Win.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of file handler registration for PWA on Windows

histogram.name: Apps.HomeLauncherTransition.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of launcher transitions in tablet mode. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when the user triggers launcher animation in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Apps.Launcher.InstallAppFromLinkResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of installing an app on the chrome://apps page. This happens when a user drags a link to this page.

histogram.name: Apps.Launcher.InstallLocallyShortcutsCreated
histogram.summary: Records the result of locally installed an app on the chrome://apps page, which involves hooking up Os integration. Specifically, this records if the shortcuts were created successfully. This happens whena user right-clicks on a greyed out webapp icon in the chrome://apps page and clicks "Install".

histogram.name: Apps.LauncherSearchQueryLengthJumped
histogram.summary: Whether or not the most recent Launcher search query differs from the previous query in length by more than one character. Search queries are issued incrementally as the user types, so this will approximately differentiate between incremental and non-incremental search queries. Emitted on each change to the launcher search query.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.AppsProfile.Creation.Duration
histogram.summary: The amount of time needed to create a lock screen apps profile. This metric is recorded only if the profile creation was successful. The lock screen apps profile is created if the user has an app enabled on Chrome OS lock screen, and is used as the context in which the app is launched on top of the lock screen.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.AppsProfile.Creation.Success
histogram.summary: Boolean indicating whether the lock screen apps profile creation succeeded. The lock screen apps profile is created if the user has an app enabled on Chrome OS lock screen, and is used as the context in which the app is launched on top of the lock screen.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.DataItemStorage.ClearTextItemSize
histogram.summary: The size of a data item stored in the lock screen data item storage using chrome.lockScreen.data API as sent from the app - the item will be encrypted before getting stored in the storage.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.DataItemStorage.EncryptedItemSize
histogram.summary: The size of an encrypted data item stored in the lock screen data item storage using chrome.lockScreen.data API.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.DataItemStorage.FailedOperationDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to complete a lock screen data item storage operation. Reported only on the operation failure.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.DataItemStorage.OperationDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to complete a lock screen data item storage operation. Reported only on the operation success.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.DataItemStorage.OperationResult
histogram.summary: The result of a lock screen data item storage operation returned through chrome.lockScreen.data extension API.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.DataItemStorage.RegisteredItemsCount
histogram.summary: The number of data items saved in the lock screen data item storage per app. This is recorded on startup, when the app attempts to use the chrome.lockScreen.data API.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.AppStatusOnNoteLaunch
histogram.summary: Reported when a user attempts to launch a note taking app on the lock screen. It reports the note taking app state in the lock screen apps profile at the launch attempt time - for example, whether the app was enabled, or whether the app had been terminated and an app reload was attempted.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.AppWindowLifeTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time a lock screen enabled app window spent in a certain state during the app window activity. The state to which the histogram refers to is defined by the suffix. The metric is logged upon leaving the associated state.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.AvailabilityOnScreenLock
histogram.summary: The note taking action availability state on the lock screen, recorded when the user session is locked.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.FinalAppSessionState
histogram.summary: The state in which lock screen enabled note taking app was when the note taking session ended.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.LaunchDurationAtLaunchCancel
histogram.summary: The amount time a lock screen app had been launching when the app launch was canceled. Logged if the lock screen app session ends before the lock screen app window is shown.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.LaunchRequestOrdinalNumber
histogram.summary: Ordinal number of a note taking app launch request from a lock screen within a lock screen session. If a note taking app is launched n times during a single lock screen session, this histogram will be reported with values 1 through n. The launch counter is reset on screen unlock.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.LaunchRequestReason
histogram.summary: The user action that launched note taking from the lock screen.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.LockScreenAppUnloaded
histogram.summary: Reported when a note taking app is unloaded from the lock screen apps profile while lock screen note taking is available. Reports the unload reason type, which can be used to deduce whether the app can be reloaded in the profile. The app unload event is not reported if the app is unloaded due to lock screen note taking becoming unavailble (e.g. when the user unlocks the screen).

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.LockScreenInstallationDuration
histogram.summary: Amount of time needed to install a copy of a lock screen note taking app into lock screen apps profile.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.NoteTakingExitReason
histogram.summary: The reason the note taking on lock screen was ended (and lock screen app window was closed).

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.ReloadCountOnAppTermination
histogram.summary: Reported when a note taking app is terminated in the lock screen apps profile. It reports the number of times the app was reloaded in the lock screen apps profile during the current lock screen session (prior to the termination).

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.TimeToLoadAppWindowContents
histogram.summary: The amount of time needed to load a note taking app window contents on the lock screen - i.e. the time passed from the user requesting an app launch to the app window contents being loaded.

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.TimeToShowWindow
histogram.summary: The amount of time needed to launch a note taking app window from the lock screen - i.e. the time passed from the user requesting an app launch to the app window appearing on the screen.

histogram.name: Apps.LogDisplayTypeClickedResultZeroState
histogram.summary: Records number of clicks on search result for different display types in zero-state.

histogram.name: Apps.NoteTakingApp.DefaultLaunchResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to launch a default note-taking app on Chrome OS. Only reported if the preferred app was unspecified or failed to launch.

histogram.name: Apps.NoteTakingApp.PreferredLaunchResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to launch the user-specified preferred note-taking app, if any, on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Apps.NumberOfFolders
histogram.summary: The number of folders that users have in their Launcher. Includes the OEM folder. This metric is recorded every time the launcher is shown.

histogram.name: Apps.NumberOfPages
histogram.summary: The number of pages that users have in the top level apps grid of their Launcher. This metric is recorded every time the launcher is shown.

histogram.name: Apps.NumberOfPagesNotFull
histogram.summary: The number of pages that are not full in the top level apps grid of Launcher. This metric is recorded every time the launcher is shown.

histogram.name: Apps.PaginationTransition.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary:
Base name is deprecated as of 3/2019 in favor of Apps.PaginationTransition.AnimationSmoothness.ClamshellMode and Apps.PaginationTransition.AnimationSmoothness.TabletMode
Relative smoothness of animations of launcher pagination transitions. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when the user starts the pagination transition animation of the launcher.

histogram.name: Apps.PaginationTransition.DragScroll.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time for the apps grid scrolling operation. This starts when drag starts by gesture and ends before the patination animation starts. The smoothness of the pagination animation is recorded in Apps.PaginationTransition.AnimationSmoothness.{TabletMode|ClamshellMode}.

histogram.name: Apps.PaginationTransition.DragScroll.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum latecy reported during one drag to scroll operation on apps grid.

histogram.name: Apps.PreferredApps.EntryCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of entries in the preferred apps list that was stored on the disk. The preferred apps list is a vector that identifies the preferred app for an intent filter. This value is recorded every time on user login and we read the stored data from the disk.

histogram.name: Apps.PreferredApps.FileIOAction
histogram.summary: Recorded at the time a read/write operation happens for preferred app to indicate whether the I/O succeeded or not. This was briefly logged under PreferredApps.FileIOAction in milestone 85.

histogram.name: Apps.PreferredApps.UpdateAction
histogram.summary: Recorded at the time a update operation happens for preferred apps to indicate the type of update action. This was briefly logged under PreferredApps.UpdateAction in milestone 85.

histogram.name: Apps.ScrollableShelf.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of the scrollable shelf when scrolling. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when the user scrolls over the scrollable shelf.

histogram.name: Apps.ScrollableShelf.Drag.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time of the drag scroll in the scrollable shelf in milliseconds.

histogram.name: Apps.ScrollableShelf.Drag.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time of the drag scroll in the scrollable shelf.

histogram.name: Apps.ShortcutsMenu.Registration.Win.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of shortcuts menu registration for PWA on Windows

histogram.name: Apps.ShortcutsMenu.Unregistration.Win.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of shortcuts menu unregistration for PWA on Windows

histogram.name: Apps.StateTransition.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of peeking launcher state transitions. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when the user switches states of the launcher.

histogram.name: Apps.StateTransition.Drag.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time of the app launcher drag operation in milliseconds.

histogram.name: Apps.StateTransition.Drag.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time of the app laucnher drag operation.
